alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 5:22PM EDT until June 26 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MORRIS COUNTY... At 522 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chatham, or over Summit, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Chatham, Boonton, Morris Plains, Mountain Lakes, Parsippany, Millington and Hanover Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 39 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 33 and 46. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
